alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Major; Woods (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:55AM CDT until May 19 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT FOR WOODS...NORTHEASTERN CUSTER...ALFALFA...BLAINE...EASTERN DEWEY AND MAJOR COUNTIES... At 155 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Alva to 6 miles southwest of Carmen to 5 miles southwest of Isabella to 4 miles south of Eagle City, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Watonga, Alva, Fairview, Cherokee, Helena, Okeene, Thomas, Waynoka, Canton, Ringwood, Custer City, Carmen, Cleo Springs, Longdale, Goltry, Ames, Meno, Jet, Aline and Burlington. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Alfalfa; Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Major; Woods
